subject: Self Care
title: Emotional Agility
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Emotional Agility.

hook.text: Susan David says: you are not your emotions. You are the person experiencing them. That distinction changes everything.

buildup.text: Emotional agility means being flexible with your feelings rather than controlled by them or suppressing them.

discovery.text: 'I am anxious' fuses you with the emotion. 'I notice anxiety' creates distance. Language shapes experience.

twist.text: Rigid emotional responses â€” always avoiding, always ruminating â€” predict depression and burnout more than stress does.

climax.text: Notice the emotion, name it, accept it, and then act on your values â€” not on the feeling. That's agility.

punchline.text: Feelings are visitors. Let them in, then let them go.

quiz.question: What is the key distinction in emotional agility?
options: Observing emotions with distance rather than fusing with them
Always acting on your strongest emotion
